intro: Colubrina guatemalensis, commonly known as Guatemalan beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various birds and small mammals.
